climbs.name: Kali Yuga
climbs.fa: Paul Burgess, Zach Seese After Hold Broke

content.description: Sit start at the base of the prow with your right and left hand on crimps, move your right hand up the arete and throw a heel hook with your right foot. Move your left hand up into a decent crimp and continue working up the arete until you fall into a wonderful circular dish on the left-hand side just below the lip. Hit the top and top out from there.
content.location: Sit starts on the arete and works up it to the top.

content.description: Sit start as for Kali Yuga on two bad crimps, do not use the arete or holds around the arete for feet or hands. Throw up to a good right-hand crimp edge, move your left hand up to a sloper pinch rail, and then get a high left foot to pressure you into a big gaston into a big slanted rail up and right. Once there, press off the rail towards the top of the boulder and top out.
content.location: Sit starts as for Kali Yuga but doesn't use the arete at all. Face holds only.

content.description: A perfect prow, what more can be said? It is reminiscent of a large ship's bow and features a wonderful overhung arete compression problem.
